oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Unified Strategy Towards N-Aryl Heterocycles by a One-Pot Copper-Catalyzed Oxidative C-H Amination of Azoles
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUBRAMANIAN, P
KALIAPPAN, KP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Synthetic methods
C-H activation
Amination
Nitrogen heterocycles
Copper
Reaction mechanisms
BOND FORMATION SYNTHESIS
REDUCTIVE ELIMINATION
COUPLING REACTION
MILD CONDITIONS
DERIVATIVES
FUNCTIONALIZATION
ACTIVATION
CARBAZOLES
AMIDATION
ROUTE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An efficient one-pot synthesis of N-aryl-substituted heterocycles by a Cu-catalyzed two-fold C-N bond formation is reported. This strategy involves a Cu-I-catalyzed C-N bond-forming reaction between azoles and electron-deficient bromopyridines followed by an intramolecular sp(2) C-H amination. One of the products thus formed has been successfully used as a ligand for the synthesis of a Pd complex.
